places.name: Alps
places.description: The Alps are the highest and most extensive mountain range that lies entirely in Europe. They are located in eight European countries.

places.name: Cornwall
places.description: Cornwall is a county in south-west England, birthplace of Humphry Davy.

places.name: Siberia
places.description: a vast Russian province encompassing most of Northern Asia, with terrain spanning tundra, coniferous forest and mountain ranges

persons.name: RichardKirwan
persons.description: Irish chemist, mineralogist and geologist who accused fellow geologist, James Hutton, of athiesm following publication of his Theory of the Earth (1788). FRSL

persons.name: ThomasThomson
persons.description: Scottish chemist and mineralogist whose writings contributed to the early spread of Dalton's atomic theory. FRSL.

persons.name: Abraham GottlobWerner
persons.description: German geologist who proposed the theory of Neptunism and who also proposed the chronological sequence found in stratified rocks.

places.name: Freiberg
places.description: A university and former mining town in Saxony, Germany

persons.name: René JustHaüy
persons.description: French priest, crystallographer and mineralogist who wrote the five volume Traité de minéralogie (1801). ForMemRSL.

persons.name: RobertJameson
persons.description: Scottish geologist and Regius Professor of Natural History at the University of Edinburgh. FRSL.

places.name: Mountsorrel
places.description: Mountsorrel is a village in Leicestershire bordering the Charnwood Forest, an upland area with isolated outcrops of ancient Precambrian igneous rocks.

places.name: Charnwood Forest
places.description: The Charnwood Forest is a upland area in Leicestershire, the highest point being 278m. The geology is remarkable as Precambrian igneous rocks, some of the oldest rocks on earth, are seen as isolated outcrops, as in Davy's sketch.

places.name: Leicestershire
places.description: A county in the East Midlands of England.

persons.name: Abraham GottlobWerner
persons.description: German geologist who proposed the theory of Neptunism and who also proposed the chronological sequence found in stratified rocks.

persons.name: BarthélemyFaujas de Saint-Fond
persons.description: French geologist, vulcanologist, and traveller. Professor of geology at the Jardin des Plantes.

persons.name: Alexander vonHumboldt
persons.description: German geographer, naturalist and explorer. ForMemRSL.

persons.name: Déodat Gratet deDolomieu
persons.description: French geologist. The rock, and region of the Alps, dolomite was named after him.

places.name: Alps
places.description: The Alps are the highest and most extensive mountain range that lies entirely in Europe. They are located in eight European countries.

places.name: Cornwall
places.description: Cornwall is a county in south-west England, birthplace of Humphry Davy.

places.name: Nether Stowey
places.description: A village in Somerset, home of the tanner Thomas Poole and formerly Samuel Taylor Coleridge.
